description: Made by major Chablis producer Jean-Marc Brocard, this wine is ripe, soft and attractively fruity. It has crisp acidity along with rich yellow fruits and a touch of minerality. The wine comes from a blend of different premier cru vineyards. Delicious and refreshing, it is ready to drink now.
title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Signature Series Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Produced by major Chablis producer Jean-Marc Brocard for the Kirkland label, this wine a blend from different premier cru vineyards. It has plenty of richness to give the wine weight while never losing sight of a steely edge and acidity. It is fruity, crisp and also ripe. Drink now.
title: 90pointsKirkland Signature 2015 Premier Cru  (Chablis)Best Buy

description: This is a terrific Chardonnay from Limoux, an area more typically known for its Blanquette (which uses the Mauzac grape) but certainly not limited to it. It's a ripe and rich wine, loaded with aromas of red apple, nectarine pit, and almond milk. The mouth shows a bit more vibrancy with flavors of lime essence backed by honeydew. Round and fantastically balanced, with a long finish kissed by toasted oak.
title: Château Rives-Blanques 2005 Cuvée de l'Odyssée Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: This wine is so well balanced. It has all the right fruitiness that's filled out by a rich texture, apricot acidity and some spice. Wait a few months to really enjoy this ripe and full-bodied wine.
title: Lucien Lardy 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A crisp wine, this is packed with acidity and fruitiness. It is tangy, tight, full of attractive acidity as well as lively citrus and white fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: Albert Bichot 2013  Saint-Véran

description: Numbered bottles, embossed grapes on the label and the inscription in homage to Robert Skalli's father, Francis, all give this wine an instantly luxurious feel. The nose is dominated by smooth, polished new wood. Aromas of smooth, ripe fruit and sophisticated wood flavors. Full-bodied, ripe wine, with upfront, modern fruit flavors. -R.V.
title: Les Vins Skalli 2000 Edition Limitee Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Made by a vigneron, which means a guy named Lavantureux actually grew the grapes and made the wine himself. It also means, at least in theory, that it received a lot of TLC. Not cheap, but an excellent value among French Chardonnay. It offers nothing but the purest of fruit: pineapple, mango, apple and then a smooth slide toward a sleek finish. Seek the vintage if possible. Yet another winner courtesy of veteran importer Kermit Lynch.
title: Roland Lavantureux 2002  Petit Chablis

description: Full of ripe, tropical fruit flavor, the wine is already generous. Apricot and mango come through the fresh acidity, giving both richness and a more textured edge. It is ready to drink, but by 2015 will be even better.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2012 Tradition  (Saint-Véran)

description: Rich wine, full in the mouth, bringing wood and ripe apple flavors well together. Delicious.
title: Manuel Seguin 2008  Viré-Clessé

description: This Chardonnay is a world-class wine available at a fraction of the cost of other excellent French examples. It boasts soft wood accents to the ripe yellow apple, pear and spiced orange tones, with zippy acidity and a mineral streak that lend freshness to the medium-weight palate. It's a layered, complex wine that will evolve well through 2022.
title: Château Rives-Blanques 2015 Odyssée Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: This is a full-bodied wine, packed with ripe fruits with a strong mineral edge. It has an intense tang from sweet orange zest that gives both texture and ripeness to the wine. Drink now.
title: Yves Giroux 2016 Vers Chânes  (Mâcon-Fuissé)

description: This single-vineyard wine is rich and crisply fruity. It has the bright, tight texture of the vintage, giving a tense character while retaining the lush, poised fruit of the vintage. It's delicious now and ready to drink.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrétes 2014 Les Plantés  (Saint-Véran)

description: Now perfectly ready to drink, this wine from vines close to Pouilly-Fuissé is ripe with yellow fruit, juicy acidity and a smooth texture. It has plenty of minerality to keep it bright and lively. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrétes 2013 Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)

description: Ripe and full in the mouth, this generous wine has yellow fruits and a warm, rich texture. Flavors of freshness flow right through the wine. Balanced and smooth at the end, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2013  Mâcon-Davayé

description: The wine is from a tiny parcel (around an acre) of vines that are over 30-years-old. It is concentrated both with fine fruit and sweet acidity. Yellow fruits are cut with lime and green plums. A touch of vanilla gives the wine a full final aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Fabrice Larochette 2015 La Grande Bruyére  (Mâcon-Fuissé)

description: Smooth and lightly toasty, this is a well-balanced, ripe wine. Attractive acidity gently supports the yellow fruits, rich texture and overall generous feel. Drink this delicious, full-bodied wine now.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2013  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: Big and rich, this wine just oozes rich, creamy caramel flavors. The fruit is superripe but still with good acidity and tastes of white peaches, toast and cinnamon. Give this wine another year and it will be delicious. Imported by Cannon Wines Limited.
title: Château de Marsannay 2003  Marsannay

description: Produced from old, low-yielding vines, this delicious wine balances crisp acidity with intense white fruit. It's poised and stylish, with a cool character expressed in its acidity and lemon zest-like aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrétes 2014 Les Sentinelles  (Saint-Véran)

description: Smooth, ripe and creamy, this wine is just right to drink now. Rich apricot and pear flavors give a pure line of fresh acidity as well as a full, round character. There is a delicious tang of orange zest at the end.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2013 Au Brûlé  (Saint-Véran)

description: A stunning white with superb balance and layer upon layer of aromas and flavors. An expressive white-flower note accents the solid backbone of ripe red apple and firm nectarine fruit. The medium-weight palate is slightly creamy but not overdone, with hints of toast, sweet spice and almond-flavored nuttiness that unfold on the finish.
title: Château Rives-Blanques 2010 Odyssée Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: A fragrant apple-skin aroma sets the scene for this wine that is warm and ripe. A touch of nutmeg adds an extra dimension to its yellow fruits. It's rich while still remaining true to its minerally, terroir-based origins. Age for two years.
title: Bernard Defaix 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: Big and bold, it's full of ripe fruits, touches of wood and a mineral textured character. It's still developing but promising an opulent character as it matures. Drink from 2015.
title: Domaines Devillard 2012 Domaine de la Garenne  (Mâcon-Azé)

description: The Dumont family's wine from multiple parcels is ripe, full of spice and rich yellow fruits. Peach and pineapple flavors are lifted by zesty lime that cuts through the richness. Drink from 2017. The family also rents the 16th-century Massey Château.
title: Demessey 2014 Clos des Avoueries  (Mâcon-Cruzille)

description: Ripe tropical-fruit flavors give this wine a rich, rounded character. The attractive apricot and peach fruits are cut by citrus acidity to keep the freshness right up front. An opulent, full-bodied wine, it's ready to drink now.
title: Domaine le Virolys 2014  Viré-Clessé

description: This is a wood-aged Chardonnay that's smooth, creamy and rich. The wine has weight, with lemon and peach flavors as well as vanilla accents from the oak. Its current fruitiness will mature and broaden well, so keep this wine for at least four years.
title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2011 Cuvée Madeleine Chardonnay (Cotes du Tarn)

description: Named after the vineyard, this wood-aged wine is rich and impressive. Great white fruits, ripe acidity and touches of toast are cut with acidity.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Eparcieux  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Soft, fruity and ripe, this is deliciously flavored with pear and melon notes. It opens slowly to reveal its wood aging and a hint of spice. Still developing, this needs 2-3 years of aging.
title: Château Vitallis 2010  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This crisp wine is packed with delicious fruit and balanced acidity. It shows some of the richness of the vintage, but goes more in a tangy, mineral direction. With lively acidity, it is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2015  Pouilly-Vinzelles

description: With a light touch of oak aging and rich apple and citrus flavors, this is a ripe wine. It is rounded although with a taut, mineral edge. The fruit and the texture of the wine promise some good aging, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine la Croix Montjoie 2016 L'Elégante  (Bourgogne Vézelay)

description: This comes from vines in Chichée on the warm right bank of the Serein River. It is a ripe wine, full of rich apricot and lime fruits and a straight line of acidity that gives the Chablis a crisp texture. The aftertaste is lively and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2015  Chablis

description: Crisp and tangy, this is a tightly knit wine. Apples and crisp citrus flavors are part of a package that also includes spice, a strong minerality and a perfumed aftertaste. The wine should age a few more months, so drink from 2017. This is a "village" wine in the northern Maçon area.
title: Pierre Merguey 2014  Mâcon-Uchizy

description: Crisp, textured and with great acidity, this wine is still developing. It is packed with fresh citrus and apple fruits cut with strong minerality. Drink this structured wine from 2017.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2014  Saint-Véran

description: Driven by a concentrated mineral character, this is initially an austere wine. It has fresh green fruit and wood flavors, very juicy while the taut side of the texture is prominent. Age for 2-3 years.
designation: Domaine des Deux Roches Vieilles Vignes
title: Collovray et Terrier 2008 Domaine des Deux Roches Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Véran)

description: This wine is packed with apple and crisp pear flavors. A generous, rich texture brings out ripe fruits that are balanced by a more flinty, zesty backdrop. Full in the mouth, this will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2013  Chablis

description: This attractive, crisp wine offers fresh acidity as well as spice and a touch of honey. It has a crisp and fruity character, balanced and ready to drink.
title: Louis Max 2016 Clos du Four  (Mâcon-Milly Lamartine)

description: Tucked into the hillside, this sheltered vineyard that also produces red wines can produce ripe bottlings like this one. With generous white fruits, good acidity and touches of wood from the barrel aging, it will develop well. Drink from 2020.
title: Maison Chanzy 2016 Les Caraby  (Mercurey)

description: Rich wine, full of yellow fruits, apricots and peaches that give ripeness. It has weight, a solidity that is balanced by the totally refreshing acidity. Hints of the wood aging give spice as well as adding to the rich effect. Age for 2-3 years.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2010 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: Full of yellow fruits, this is a ripe and lightly wood-aged wine. Great acidity and plenty of rich but lively fruitiness play well together, leading into a crisp aftertaste. It needs to age a bit more, so drink from 2018.
title: Vins Auvigue 2014 Solutré  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Fully fruity right up front, this rounded wine has a crisp element that cuts through the richness. Peach and pear flavors contrast with orange zest and lively final acidity.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: White fruits and delicious soft acidity make this wine immediately attractive. It is rich and fresh at the same time, with just a touch of apple skin structure. The name of the wine refers to the Solutré rock which towers over the vineyards.
title: Jean-Pierre et Michel Auvigué 2006 Solutré  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A tight and structured wine, this is still young, but the great fruit and mineral texture indicate fine potential. It has green fruits, crisp acidity and a nervy character that will soften. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2017 Pascal Renaud Champs de Perdrix  (Saint-Véran)

description: Wood aromas set the scene for a wine that shows wood-aging flavors. Spice, vanilla, baked apple and citrus flavors all mingle easily and to great effect. The wine, with its textured character, could age another year or two. Drink from 2015.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2012 Domaine des Dexu Roches PRC  (Saint-Véran)

description: A full-bodied wine, this is rich and packed with fruits. It is generous in its texture and green-plum and pear flavors. Warm and ripe, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Christophe Cordier 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This wine is rich and rounded, with some wood flavors and plenty of spice. Creamy with swathes of ripe pear and quince flavors, it's just now ready to drink and has a great balance between acidity and richness.
title: Domaine Dugois 2015 Terre de Marne Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: Bringing together old vines from a number of the Chablisienne cooperative's vineyards, this wine is concentrated and finely structured. Its rich creamed apple and tangy orange zest flavors are lit by acidity and a mineral edge. Drink from 2018.
title: La Chablisienne 2014 Les Vénérables  (Chablis)

description: Good, creamy, caramel-and yellow fruit-flavored wine, finely balanced. The elements are all there, knit together, leaving honey and baked apple flavors to finish.
title: Nicolas Maillet 2008  Mâcon-Verze

description: Spicy, toasty aromas are the theme of the wood-laden palate of this wine. Apricot and mango fruit lies behind this vanilla character. The wine is rich, needing further time for the wood to integrate. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: With ripe fruits, this generous wine also has a great line of acidity. A touch of vanilla gives extra richness. At the same time, the balance with the fresh lemon flavors and ripe peaches is just right. Drink now.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2014  Pouilly-Loché

description: This mineral, structured wine is full of lemon, crisp green apple and fragrant acidity. It's ripe while also fresh and taut. A tangy texture shoots through the wine, giving a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: From a small appellation next to Pouilly-Fuissé, this is a ripe, full wine. It is all white stone fruit, pears and green plums, given structure by the zesty, mineral texture. It is a rich single-vineyard wine from vines up to 70 years old. Drink from late 2018.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Crisp and fruity, this bright, textured wine has a tangy character that is juicy and refreshing. Lively and rich, it is ready to drink although it will be better from 2017.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2014 Hors Classe  (Saint-Véran)

description: There's good concentration with this wine. It shows green apples, pears and green plum skin flavors. On top, there is wood, well balanced with the fruit; a sumptuous mix that shows the generosity of 2005.
designation: Domaine des Deux Roches Vieilles Vignes
title: Collovray et Terrier 2005 Domaine des Deux Roches Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Véran)

description: This wine is full in the mouth, with swathes of ripe apricot and mango fruit flavors. It has weight, a touch of spice and great acidity that emphasizes the general richness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Michel 2013  Viré-Clessé

description: A rich wine that has a creamy texture, this is generous while also striking a strongly mineral note. After nearly two years in bottle, the delicious fruit is rounded with layers of apple, ripe pear and crisper lime flavors. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Cheneviéres 2016 Les Grandes Vignes  (Chablis)

description: From mainly clay soil, this is a rich and rounded wine. It starts soft and generous; the structure, intense fruits and acidity only slowly come through. It's smooth, rich and concentrated, ready to drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2013 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Good wood, spice, ripe plum juice and balanced acidity. This is a wine with potential, balanced and rich.
title: Pierre Vessigaud 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Starts with honey and spice aromas that give way to ultraripe pears and smoky minerals on the palate. This is a Mâcon of uncommon finesse and harmony, ending with an extra flourish of spice. Drink now-2010. Imported by Daniel Johnnes Wines.
title: Domaine Olivier Merlin 2003 Terroir de Clessé  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This is a densely textured wine, full of flavors of lemon zest and green apples. The intense fruitiness lights the palate with a crisp feel as well as final, tight acidity.
title: Rijckaert 2011 En Paradis Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: This Chardonnay shows a beautiful minerality supported by rich and pronounced flavors of cantaloupe, wood-grilled peaches and smokey roasted almonds. It's medium weight and lush in the mouth, with a long evolving finish. Drink while it's still got some chill to it, as the alcohol is a bit too pronounced after warming too much.
title: Domaine Begude 2006 L'Etoile de Begude Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: Named after the church next door to the producer's winery, this wine comes from 70-year-old vines. It has depth, richness and good concentration. Made from organically grown grapes, the wine is bright with yellow fruits and citrus. Drink now
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2017 Vieilles Vignes de Sainte-Claire  (Chablis)

description: Old vines from the vineyard next to the winery produce a luscious full wine. With its pear, peach and ripe apple flavors, these 70-year-old vines show their richness and concentration. It is opulent, structured and packed with juicy acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2015 Vieilles Vignes de Sainte-Claire  (Chablis)

description: Well-balanced wine, ripe fruit, touches of wood, light spice, ginger and sweet apples. Structured, held well together by wood.
title: Jean Manciat 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon-Charnay)

description: Ripe and creamy, with touches of honey, this wine is smooth and rich. A pinch of spice as well as almonds go with the richness. Drink this full-bodied wine from 2019.
title: Rijckaert 2017 Les Crays vers Vaux  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: Ripe and rich, this offers layers of yellow fruits over a crisper, more steely texture. From one of the largest vineyards in Montagny, this concentrated wine needs time to develop. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Feuillat-Juillot 2013 Les Coéres Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: While this wine does not age in wood, it does age on its lees, giving it a rich, creamy texture. It's smooth, full and soft, its apricot and peach flavors showing ripeness and openness. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2015 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A rich, ripe wine, striated with yellow fruits, acidity and spice from wood. It is warm and generous, while not losing sight of its origins in the streak of minerality. A fine, attractive wine that could do with another year's aging.
title: Evening Land 2011  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Different parcels of old vines in the south of the appellation produce a smooth and well-balanced wine. With touches of toast as well as crisp lemon and ripe melon fruits, it is rich and intense with lively, juicy acidity. A generous wine, it is ready to drink.
designation: Les Terres du Sud Viellies Vignes
title: Rijckaert 2014 Les Terres du Sud Viellies Vignes  (Saint-Véran)

description: This broad and ripe wine features a buttery texture and generous yellow fruits. Lightly textured with acidity, it has peach and pear flavors that give opulence and richness. A touch of toast adds to the warmth.
title: Dominique Cornin 2012 Les Serrendiéres  (Mâcon Chaintré)

description: Full, rich and fat, this is classic, ripe yellow fruit-flavored Meursault with good acidity. A finely balanced, wood-aged wine with good concentration from the lees stirring during fermentation.
title: Manuel Olivier 2008  Meursault

description: This wine is well balanced, ripe with apricot and white-peach flavors that contrast with the kiwi and grapefruit freshness. A more mineral edge gives texture. This delicious wine will be even better to drink from 2017.
title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: From a five-acre vineyard, the wine has some clean steeliness layered with ripe citrus and white fruits. Acidity brings out apple and crisp pear skin flavors. Drink this immaculate wine from 2015.
title: Château des Rontets 2011 Clos Varambon  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Initially soft, the wood and the ripe fruits of this wine develop slowly in the mouth. Then it becomes rich, generous, although with great acidity from the green plum and pink grapefruit freshness. A balanced wine, it will develop well into 2016 and can be drunk now.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2013 Créches  (Saint-Véran)

description: Rich while also structured, it has a mineral texture that gives fine acidity and a tight feel, all balanced by ripe apricot fruits. The wine should round out by 2015 to give a ripe, full-bodied feel.
title: Domaine Perraud 2012  Saint-Véran

description: A small parcel in the 147-acre Haute-Serre estate has been converted to Chardonnay production. The wine is rich, smooth and with apricot and peach fruits. The wood aging balances with the ripe fruits that are lightly cut with acidity at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2013 Haute-Serre Albesco Chardonnay (Cotes du Lot)

description: Vincent Leflaive was the uncle of Olivier Leflaive. The wine, from old vines, is made in homage to him. Impressively rich and full-bodied, it has some toastiness as well as fresh acidity and apple and citrus flavors. It's tight at the moment, showing a steely character that will soften. Drink from 2016.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012 Oncle Vincent  (Bourgogne)

description: A blend from different Premier Cru vineyards across Chablis, this wine is the product of the wide choice of grapes available to this cooperative. It's soft and ripe yet shows the crisper edge typical of the vintage. Drink from 2018.
title: La Chablisienne 2014 Grande Cuvée Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The relatively unknown Côte de Léchet vineyard is on the southern bank of the Serein river, which gives it a cool exposure. The result in 2006 is a wine that is light, delicate, floating on fresh green fruits and honeyed toast. It needs food, with its crisp, fine finish.
title: La Chablisienne 2006 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A rounded, fruity wine, packed with yellow peaches and apricots, but held in check by freshness, green herbs and a firm, steely character. It's not a wine to age for long, but it is delicious, and very seductive now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2005 Mont-de-Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Initially this is caramel and fresh fruit layered with acidity. Then the minerality kicks in with a vengeance, structuring the ripe green flavors, and leaving tense acidity.
title: La Chablisienne 2005 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Thanks to the vintage, this is showing more fat than usual, yet still retains a gorgeous sense of balance. Orange and mineral flavors dance on the palate, accompanied by hints of apple, pineapple and lime. From a biodynamic producer, with no added yeasts, no chaptalization and no wood aging. Imported by Kysela Pére et Fils.
title: Guillemot-Michel 2003 Quintaine  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Old vines, around 45 years in age, form the basis of this single-vineyard wine. It is beautifully fruity, crisp and with good acidity and a tangy, citrus edge. The wine is intensely fruity and well balanced.
title: Château de Chamilly 2015 Les Reculerons  (Montagny)

description: This single-vineyard wine was wood aged more to open it up than to impart too much wood flavor. The success shows in the intense tropical fruit, rich acidity and just the lightest touch of spice. It's a full wine, ready to age further. Drink from 2020
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2016 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The smoothness of white wines in this vintage is very apparent in this ripe, rounded bottling. With enough acidity and citrus flavors to balance the melon and peppered-pear flavors, the wine is balanced and full in the mouth. Age until 2019.
title: Vins Auvigue 2015 Solutré  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A smooth and creamy wine, this is tight and structured, with good acidity to match. The mineral texture and tangy character are matched by generous fruitiness. The wine needs some time. Drink from late 2018.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2016  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: "Fullness and goodness" is a rough translation of the name of this wine. It's an accurate description of its richness. There is great spice, bolstering the full fruit, showing a mineral, chalky structure along with fresh green fruits.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2005 Plénitude de Bonté  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Soft and ripe, this wine has juicy pineapple and pear flavors. And with its tension between richness and steeliness, this could certainly age.
designation: Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay
title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay  (Rully)

description: Ten months of wood aging has given this wine richness and fine spiciness. It is rich while still textured with minerality and tight citrus flavors. With its juicy acidity, the wine will age. Drink from 2018.
title: Philippe Jeannot 2015 Clos des Hâtes  (Santenay)

description: In the north of the appellation, this parcel of 50-year-old vines has produced a round, smooth and creamy wine. Yellow fruits and the slightest touch of oxidation as well as the wood flavors give a rich wine freshened by final lemon acidity.
title: Rijckaert 2013 Les Vercherres Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: A rich wine with tropical fruit flavors that are warm and ripe. Peaches and apricots are added to canned pineapple and balanced with good acidity. This fruit-salad character gains backbone from the apple skin texture and toast that come through at the end.
title: Fabrice Closset 2012 Chanson Chardonnay (Cotes du Jura)

description: Touches of matchstick, garrigue herbs and lime leaf complement the green apple- and pear-fruit core of this well-balanced, attractive Chardonnay. There's a slight creaminess to the palate, lifted by medium acidity to keep the mouthfeel fresh and the finish clean. Accents of toast and sweet spice dance on the close.
title: S. Delafont 2012 Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: With a wine from every cru in Chablis, La Chablisienne is able to bring out the character of each. This cool Côte de Léchet is typical in its tight, mineral character, revealing its edgy nature. It's a wine with some aging potential, so give it 2-3 years and more.
title: La Chablisienne 2008 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A lightly smoky aroma shows the wood aging of this wine. It is toasty, with a mineral touch, and the ripe yellow fruits are developing well. Smooth and potentially rich, this needs a few more months to show at its best. Drink from 2015.
title: La Soufrandiére 2012 Clos de Grand Pére  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

description: With an element of wood aging, this is a rich, concentrated Pouilly Fuissé. It has a smooth, creamy texture layered with vanilla and wood acidity, but also pear juice freshness. There is an element of minerality along with a dried raisin flavor that gives extra complexity. Imported by Cellar Door Selections.
title: Domaine Gonon 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: With its spice and wood flavors, this wine is rich and deliciously concentrated. It has a bold yellow fruit and spice character that is warm and rounded. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Marcel Couturier 2015 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: Perfectly round Chardonnay, not an edge or angle in sight. The wine is soft, juicy, broad, but never going over the top, keeping freshness and green fruits in play as a counterweight.
designation: Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay
title: Antonin Rodet 2006 Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay  (Rully)

description: The natural warmth of this premier cru vineyard is emphasized in 2015. The wine is ripe and rich with a light touch of oak to underline the fruitiness. The texture has some minerality and a cool steely edge. Drink from 2018.
title: Etienne Boileau 2015 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From the coolest of the Premier Cru vineyards, this is a crisp wine, packed with minerality as well as tight green fruits. The aftertaste with its flinty edge is spicy as well as deliciously fruity. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Fourrey 2014 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: There is enticing new wood here, a wine that shows richness to boost the ripe, creamy apple and pear fruits. It has a generous character, to contrast with its core of steely acidity. The finish is more earthy, suggesting the wine still needs time in the bottle.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2007 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: More powerful than Monsieur Robert's La Croix bottling, but not quite as long, with assertive flavors of honey, anise and oranges. A bold statement in Pouilly-Fuissé. Imported by Kermit Lynch.
title: Domaine Robert-Denogent 2002 Les Reisses  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This warm, rounded and ripe wine offers balanced fruit and acidity. A crisp edge to the rich pear and spicy flavor is lifted by an attractive touch of cinnamon. The final acidity is steely, bringing in a mineral element. Drink now.
title: Domaine Gilles Morat 2014 Domaine Chataigneraie-Laborier Terroirs de Vergisson  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Full of bright yellow fruits, this is ripe, rounded and already delicious. Rich mango and peach flavors contribute an exotic edge to the more mineral texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine La Soufrandise 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Big and ripe, this rich wine offers a good combination of spice and tropical fruits. It is bold, smooth and creamy. Deliciously ripe, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine Michel 2015  Viré-Clessé

description: This is a beautifully aromatic wine with toast and yellow fruits mingling easily together. It is ripe while also light to taste, a crisp burst of acidity giving the wine a fine lift. Yellow fruits, citrus and toast play together in this attractive wine that is ready to drink.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2014 Oncle Vincent  (Bourgogne)

description: Befitting a premier cru, there's a hint of honeyed ripeness to this wine's aromas and flavors. Sweetened lime notes accent apples and pears on the palate, ending in a rush of ripe fruit and minerals.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2004 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wine is fat, fruity and creamy, with just a touch of minerality. Its ripe fullness lends plenty of depth and concentration, within a lightly structured frame. Drink from 2018.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2015 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Full, ripe and rounded, this wine has the warmth of 2009, giving a Chablis with a richer texture than usual. It brings out the wood, spice and melon characters. It needs a year or two aging to get it at its best.
designation: Les Vieilles Vignes Fourchaume Premier Cru
title: Pascal Bouchard 2009 Les Vieilles Vignes Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With 24 acres in this premier cru vineyard, Laroche is able to produce this mineral- and grapefruit-flavored wine in good quantities. There is a touch of caramel, balanced with excellent lively acidity. A fresh but full-bodied wine that will age well over the next 2-3 years. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2005 Vaudevey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A piercingly steely wine, all angles and acidity. That said, there's a greater depth of flavor that needs time to come out-the richness of the green fruit is there, as is the hint of wood. The corners need to soften for a year or so.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2005 Montmain Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This 16-acre estate is run biodynamically, producing intensely flavored, honeyed, ripe wines. This is succulent from ripe fruit, with the acidity bright and vivid, finishing with sweet pineapple and apricot flavors.
title: Domaine Guillemot-Michel 2008 Quintaine  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: With balanced fruitiness, this is a taut, mineral wine with juicy pear and apple flavors as well as a touch of spice. Perfumed, fruity and ready to drink, it is a fine, terroir-driven wine.
title: Pascal Rollet 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Attractive spice and toast aromas add richness to this wine. They lie over the ripe white-stone-fruit flavors that are freshened by citrus. It is still too young to be fully integrated, so wait until 2017 to drink this wine.
title: Marcel Couturier 2014 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: Full of tropical fruits, this ripe, textured wine is rich in aromas and depth. Abundant peach and apricot flavors give immediate pleasure and attractiveness. Drink this opulent wine now.
title: Domaine Pignier 2011 A la Percenette Chardonnay (Cotes du Jura)

description: Mont de Milieu is a popular Chablis Premier Cru, deliciously soft and ripe, only lightly mineral. It does have a fine streak of acidity that propels it along to a zingy green plum finish.
title: La Chablisienne 2008 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Very soft, rounded wine, with yellow fruits, peaches and apricots vying with spice from wood for supremacy. At the heart, there is some steely character, but this is a big-hearted, full-on wine.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2006 Les Fourneaux Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The wine continues the rise in quality of whites from this producer. It is refined, elegant, not powerful, but with a great balance between wood and fruit, and a long, lingering green fruit aftertaste.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2005 Cuvée Signature Premier Cru Morgeot  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Warm, rounded and full bodied, this has flavors of yellow fruit, apple and pear notes, with a touch of attractive wood spice. There is a fine burst of uplifting acidity on the finish.
title: Domaines Devillard 2009 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: This luscious wine is generously rich, with honey flavors to go with the tropical fruits. It is balanced with acidity while also ripe and full bodied. This wine is very ready to drink.
title: Madame Veuve Point 2016  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: The aroma says wood, and that's what the taste confirms. To go with the wood, there is rounded apricot and peach-flavored fruit, open and rich. The wine has a youthful taut edge, finishing with the greatest acidity.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2007  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Luscious and rich, this wine has a mineral edge that will allow it to age. Tropical fruits combine with fresh citrus to add fruitiness to the structure. Drink from 2019.
title: Rijckaert 2017 En Crêches  (Saint-Véran)

description: From vines averaging 60 years of age in Jurassic chalky clay, this ripe, buttery wine has plenty of ripe apples, pears and a generous texture. An attractive touch of toast adds to the complexity. Drink now.
title: Pierre Merguey 2014 Clos de la Maison  (Saint-Véran)

description: This textured, ripe wine shows the potential of Chardonnay in the Beaujolais region. The 2.5 acres of vines average seven years in age, so still have a lot of time to mature. Still, the wine has a tight, mineral character balanced by yellow and white fruits as well as refreshing final acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Lathuiliére-Gravallon 2014 Roche Noire  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This limited-production wine from old vines is aged in wood, giving it a rich character by adding hints of toast while also enhancing the fruit. It's a ripe wine that will likely age. Drink now for its young, fruity character or age until late 2018.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2016 Eparcieux  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Made with skin contact and whole berry maceration to give extra flavor, this is a structured wine with a strong texture along with orange zest and light honey flavors. It is dense and concentrated. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Pinson 2013 Cuvée Mademoiselle  (Chablis)

description: A wine that is tight, structured while rich. That gives a mineral grittiness as well as more tropical and wood aging flavors. Together, the tastes merge into a complex, full-bodied wine that ends with just the right amount of acidity.
title: Domaine Corine Perchaud 2010 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Finely structured and aromatic, this is initially dense before opening up with ripe yellow fruit, becoming balanced by orange- and tangerine-like acidity. It has a young, zesty texture that pairs with the rich concentration, promising to age over 3-4 years.
title: La Chablisienne 2010 Monte de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A soft, textured wine that is still developing. Pear and white currant flavors offer acidity and fruit, while there is a good chalk dust edge. It needs another year to develop.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2009 Montmains  (Chablis)

description: A ripe, full wine, immediately accessible, speaking both of minerality and fresh acidity. The fruit goes right to the green apples, kiwi and juicy lemon flavors, but the structure is bold and rounds out these crisp fruits. A wine for aging, perhaps 2-3 years.
title: La Chablisienne 2006 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Full and rich, this balanced wine offers plenty of attractive citrus and spice flavors. There is also a creamy background to this generous, ripe wine, plus a lift of acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2016 En Beauvois  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: In this ripe wine, yellow fruits, cinnamon and ripe herbs are melded into a harmonious whole. Great acidity offers a juicy core to this well-balanced wine. Drink now for its great refreshing character.
title: Christophe Cordier 2013 Clos du Four  (Mâcon-Milly Lamartine)

description: This is a floral wine, ripe and creamy. It has spice and toast from wood aging along with good acidity and impressiver richness. The wine is full-bodied, spicy, full of yellow and pear fruits. Drink from 2019
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015  Marsannay

description: Xavier and Kerrie de Boissieu, 13th generation at this estate, farm organic and biodynamic vineyards and use wild yeasts in fermentation. The combo helps enhance the fruitiness of this ripe, clean and perfumed wine. With its ripe acidity plus creamy apple and zesty lemon flavors, the wine is balanced and worth aging a few months. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Lavernette 2016 Maison du Villard  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This ripe, full wine has an attractive spice and toast character. Warm yellow fruits and a rich feel indicate the generous, rounded potential. The wine has a crisp side as well as a mineral touch. Drink now, but better from 2017.
title: Christophe Cordier 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is soft and fruity, lifted by a shot of acidity. Fragrant yellow fruits and crisper lime are attractively in balance. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Crisp and young, this wine, from 50-year-old vines, is tangy and strongly mineral in texture. It is full of fresh fruit that reflects the of organic and biodynamic farming. The green fruits will fill out as it ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Lavernette 2014 Maison du Villard  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has wood aromas and light toast flavor. They fill out the palate with spice and vanilla, giving a wine that is concentrated, tangy and aromatic. Acidity at the end adds juiciness and freshness.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2013 Vignes Blanche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is full of rich, ripe yellow and white fruits, layering the fruitiness with a wood and spice character. The combination creates a complex, minerally wine that needs to age over at least 4-5 years.
title: Château de Fuissé 2010 Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Soft wine, now ripe and open, its fruit just masking almonds, toast and sweet cream. The acidity gives backbone to this mature wine which is concentrated yet with a touch of acidity and spice.
title: Loron et Fils 2005 Les Vieux Murs Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Caramel aromas announce a wine that is soft, rounded, with honey and butter flavors. The wine is rounded, rich.
title: Château de Fuissé 2008 Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A smoothly textured wine, full and ripe, with great pear flavors, giving rich acidity as well as a texture that shows apricot skins and green plums.
title: Manuel Seguin 2008  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is ripe, rounded and fwell balanced. It has great fruitiness, spice from wood aging and a generous texture. The wine is delicious, rich and ready to drink.
title: Clos des Rocs 2015 Clos des Rocs Monopole  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: Produced from old vines in a single vineyard, this concentrated wine is packed with yellow fruits and rich creamed-apple flavors brought together by crisp acidity. The wine is dense, ripe and full of fruit, with a final mineral texture. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrétes 2016 Croix de Montceau  (Saint-Véran)

description: This single-vineyard wine shows considerable potential. It offers a touch of spice as well as open, ripe and full yellow fruits. With just the right amount of acidity and a tangy orange and lemon zest texture, it is maturing well. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2016 Les Maillettes  (Saint-Véran)

description: Lightly wood aged, this wine is rich and concentrated. Flavors range from toastiness and spice to ripe yellow fruits with great density.
title: Ernest Merguey-Perron 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: A big, toasty wine, full of ripe, delicious fruit, veering toward opulence. There are open yellow fruits along with toast and butter tastes. This is almost ready to drink now; only the acidity promises some aging.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2006 Fourchaume Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Ripe tropical fruits, peach and pear flavors mingle well in this rich, toasty wine. To balance, there is citrus freshness, but the ripe flavors dominate. An immediately delicious wine that could be drunk now.
title: Faiveley 2007 Clos Rochette  (Mercurey)

description: This is a great Meursault that's full of round, ripe, generous fruit. It's packed with yellow fruit and kiwi flavors. Revel in its richness. This wine comes from Bouchard's own vines.
title: Bouchard Pére & Fils 2004 Les Clous  (Meursault)

description: This is a beautifully rounded wine with just a hint of green fruits. There is spice from the wood, adding extra dimension, along with apple acidity. Minerality gives texture at the end.
title: Domaine Luc et Lise Pavelot 2011  Pernand-Vergelesses

description: Strong wood aromas and flavors dominate the wine at this young stage. Good fruit and a steely texture lie behind the toast. As those yellow fruits develop, it will become a delicious, while always structured wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château des Rontets 2012 Clos Varambon  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Fine and fresh, brightened by grapefruit, lemon zest and bright acidity, this is a delicious wine, ready for seafood, finishing so clean and crisp.
title: Gilles Morat 2008 La Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A finely balanced wine, bringing together the new wood flavors with structured tropical fruits. Plangent acidity is the binding agent, giving an excitingly refreshing wine with a bright finish.
title: Pierre André 2008 Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Finely textured, with great minerality as well as ripe fruit. Flavors range from peach to lime, a reflection of the warm vintage and the chalk soil. Acidity is important, giving a contrast to the richness.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2009 Montée de Tonnerre  (Chablis)

description: Excellent quality for a villages wine, with layers of peaches and tropical fruit over a core of mineral and spice. Full-bodied and harmonious, with a long finish that echoes with peach, mineral and oak. Drink now. Imported by Dreyfus, Ashby & Co. -J.C.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2003  Meursault

description: Initially, the wine appears soft, with a noticeable layer of wood. The yellow fruit comes slowly through the spice, adding fruit richness. At the end, a burst of refreshing acidity finishes the wine with a lift. Worth aging for 2-3 years. Imported by Dreyfus, Ashby & Co.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2006 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From a small vineyard in the north of the Côte de Nuits, this is a rare white wine in a red-wine region. Lightly toasty, it has spice, pear flavors and perfumed acidity. It's bright and crisp, ending with lively acidity.
title: Alex Gambal 2014  Fixin

description: Open and soft, with rich, attractive flavors of caramel, milk custard and peaches. There is ripeness in abundance, followed by great intensity of flavor. Subtle wood underlies the wine.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2006  Mâcon-Verze

description: This villages Meursault shows a greater degree of elegance and harmony than Drouhin's 2001 Perrieres, blending honey, citrus and toast aromas into a seamless bouquet. Flavors consist of lightly grilled peaches and plums, finishing with a zesty blast of limes.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2001  Meursault

description: A tightly wrought, crisp texture gives the typical cool character of this appellation. This wine is full of white fruits layered with juicy acidity. Full in the mouth, it is delicious to drink although it will be better from 2017.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Pernand-Vergelesses

description: Full and rich, this single-estate wine is generous and ripe. Spice and yellow-fruit flavors are right up front, giving the wine generosity. Good balancing acidity offers the lift the wine needs. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine Beranger  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This rich wine has a ripe texture of minerality, spice and delicious apricot and creamed-apple flavors. Made from organic grapes, it is a rounded wine with warmth and fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Clos des Rocs 2016 Clos des Rocs Monopole  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: Intensely bright and crisp, this also has a full weight of fruitiness. Apples, creamed pears and a light touch of vanilla give a complex, dense wine that's so fresh at the end. It's still youthful; better wait until 2016.
title: Romain Bouchard 2012 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a ripe, toasty wine with rich yellow fruits and a smooth texture. Now totally mature, this is delicious, full and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Perraud 2015  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse

description: This rich wine is full of ripe yellow and melon fruitiness, showing the ripeness of the vintage. It has just the right acidity to balance the opulent fruit and the spice from wood aging. Drink now.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2015 Vignes Blanches  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: From a small parcel at the base of the hill of Beaune, this is a delicious wine with a touch of vanilla. It is rounded, smooth and rich, bringing out both fruit and toasty wood flavors that are integrated well. Drink from 2016.
title: Louis Latour 2011 Clos Saint-Désiré  (Beaune)

description: This is a complex, structured wine. With its rich white stone fruit flavors and touch of chalky  minerality, this is going to be a great, complete Chablis. Imported by Remy Cointreau USA.
title: Domaine Laroche 2003 Premier Cru Les Fourchaumes  (Chablis)

description: This is balanced and refined, as a grand cru should be, with a complex bouquet of honeysuckle, hay, mild vanilla and mineral-earth notes.  The complexity continues on the palate where mineral soy, floral and cinnamon elements play, though there's not particularly brisk acidity or internal tension here.  Closes with good length and style, if a bit fuller, more masculine and spicy than expected.  Drink now.
title: J. Moreau & Fils 1997 Valmur  (Chablis)

description: The wine is still young, with a dense and full-bodied series of flavors that are still developing. As it matures the ripe yellow fruits will come through strongly, assisted by the citrus zest and contrasting with the tight, nervy texture. Expect the wine to be ready in 2016.
title: Domaine Ellevin 2012 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a tightly textured wine that has plenty of green stone fruit as well as a bitter almond edge. It is taut, and the fruit has not completely surfaced yet. Age for three years.
title: Château de Maligny 2010 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A finely textured wine, with its acidity and apple fruits laced with wood and spice. It is rich, full in the mouth, a wine that has great pure flavors, very clear right to the end. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2009 Les Vaillons Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: Still young, closed and tight, this exhibits intense, crisp minerality. At this stage, the wine is all texture, with its green and white fruits suppressed. There is a vivid, vibrant character, which promises aging over the next 4-5 years. Imported by Cellar Door Selections.
title: Domaine Christophe Camu 2007 Beauroy Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: There's a fine balance here between minerality and rich toast. The result is a very pure but ripe wine, dominated by a good mix of ripe white fruits and honey.
title: William Févre 2005 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Although this wine does not come from a premier-cru vineyard, it hails from a single vineyard that regularly produces delicious white wines. This bottling, rich as befits the year, also has an attractive bright, crisp edge that contrasts with the warm yellow fruits. Drink the wine from 2019.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey En Pierrelet  (Mercurey)

description: A spicy, nutty wine that shows some of the Meursault broadness but also offers some subtlety, with ripe fruits layered with more complex wood and herb flavors. This could age well over the next 2-3 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2004  Meursault

description: This taut and textured wine shows considerable potential. The wine is packed with minerality, with tight apple and green plum fruits. On the finish hints of vanilla and more mature flavors are starting to come through. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Thierry Drouin 2012 En Buland  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A complex, wood-aged wine, full in the mouth, balancing well between toast and sweet melon and apple flavors, spiked with grapefruit acidity. It would be worth aging for 2-3 years.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2008 Elevé en Fûts de Chêne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Ripe, soft, with just the right amount of fresh acidity. The wine has a bright texture, crispness, rounded out by pear flavors, topped with cream.
title: Château Vitallis 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Big and opulent, this has ripe tropical fruits, with a soft, toasty texture and full-bodied feel. With its richness, this is developing quickly and is already ready to drink.
title: Michel Picard 2009  Puligny-Montrachet

description: In the hills above Chassagne-Montrachet, this vineyard has produced a clean and piercingly fruity wine with flavors of citrus and green apple, along with zingy acidity. It's a full while deliciously crisp wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2015 Pitangerets Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)
winery: Domaine Au Pied du Mont Chauve

description: Smoothly rich and full of ripe apple and apricot flavors, this wine is already delicious. However, good acidity and a mineral texture promise plenty of aging. It finishes with tangy, zestily spiced acidity. One can drink this wine now for its youth, but it's better to wait until 2020.
title: Domaine Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2015 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)
winery: Domaine Au Pied du Mont Chauve

description: With its dry-laid stone walls that look like a dog's teeth, this strangely named vineyard has produced an almost mineral wine, although with rounded sweet fruits and well-integrated acidity. It will need time to develop its full weight.
designation: Les Murgers des Dents de Chien
title: Roux Pére et Fils 2009 Les Murgers des Dents de Chien  (Saint-Aubin)

description: A ripe wine from a warm vintage, this is full, rich and ready to drink. Hints of toast accompany smooth lemon curd and quince flavors, along with balanced acidity that has now softened into the generous wine. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrétes 2015 Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)

description: Bringing out great warmth and soft richness, this is an open wine. A touch of wood aging gives a toasty edge, balancing the ripe apricot, creamed apple and spice flavors. Drink this rich wine from 2018.
title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2016  Viré-Clessé

description: A full-bodied, slightly oxidative wine that wears its character well. There is a toastiness here along with some apple and apricot fruits, giving a rich feel to the wine. It's ready to drink but can also continue to age until 2017-2018.
title: Andre et Mireille Tissot 2011 Les Graviers Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: There's a subtle flinty character to the nose of this Chardonnay, supported by more assertive notes of toasted apple, tangerine, pear and lime rind. It's a well-balanced selection, with a bright finish that offers a soft toasted spice accent on the close.
title: Domaine de Baronarques 2013 le Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: This is a delicious, soft, tropical fruit-flavored wine. The texture is ripe, full, the mango fruits melting in the mouth, just touched by spice. If it misses the more mineral character of Chablis, the pleasure is sufficient compensation. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2006 Les Vaudevey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Powerful, intense wood aromas dominate this wine initially. But on the palate, there are also fruit flavors that push at the wood, giving delicious apricot,  white fruits and some honey to go along with the vanilla tastes.
title: Roux Pére et Fils 2004 Les Chaumes  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a ripe mango and pineapple flavored wine. It is rich, generous and with a fine balance between acidity and the bold fruitiness. It is young and fruity, ready to drink although it will be even better from 2018.
title: Château de Lavernette 2014 Cuvée Jean-Jacques de Boissieu  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A full, rounded wine, packed with rich fruits. While it is soft, the texture is bright, crisp and delicious.
title: Bret Brothers 2008 Les Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This big, mouthfilling wine combines apples and pears with floral, mineral notes of smoky quartz and graphite. It's firm enough to age up to 10 years, yet approachable now.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2001  Puligny-Montrachet

description: This is a creamy, smooth wine. Vanilla and ripe quince flavors combine easily into a rich blend with a mineral edge. This full-bodied wine is easy to drink now and will also age. For best effect wait until late 2018.
title: Domaine Michel Briday 2016 La Pucelle Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: Beautiful  green-plum flavored fruit shows how good Saint-Aubin can be. The vanilla flavors from wood fermentation and aging simply underline the pure, vivid flavors. Drink in three to 10 years.
title: Roux Pére et Fils 2004 Les Cortons Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Big, ripe and surprisingly fat for 2006 Chablis, this wine goes for the yellow fruits as well as minerality. It offers full flavors, an up-front fruitiness tempered by a creamy backdrop. Age for 1-2 years.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils 2006 Vaillon Premier Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils

description: Produced at Château Ravatys for négociant Florent Descombe, this wine is rich and creamy. Wood aging has given it light toastiness and fine, ripe white fruit flavor. Already sophisticated wine, it will age further and be better from 2018.
title: Florent Descombe 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: This is bright and ripe wine. It comes from a single vineyard just behind the chateau of Chamirey. It is warm, rich and generous with a mineral texture and shining acidity. The wine is full of yellow fruits that are contrasted with lemon and a final lively aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey En Pierrelet  (Mercurey)

description: Seems a bit muted on the nose, offering little beyond the suggestion of honeyed fruit, but really takes off on the palate, exploding with floral notes and an intensity that belies its lightness of body. There's some buttered richness, but also fine minerality. Imported by Kysela Pére et Fils.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2003 Clos sur la Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: There is a toasty aroma in this wine that comes from a premier cru next door to Chassagne-Montrachet. This toastiness continues into a spicy, toasty note. A good sense of fruitiness gives the wine a ripe and rich character that will allow it to mature well. Drink from 2017.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2012 Pitangerets Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This lively, crisp wine comes from a less than an acre of organically grown vines. It has big lemon and green-apple flavors as well as intense acidity that gives a juicy character. With its youthful freshness, it could do with a few more months to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2014 Sur la Carriére  (Saint-Véran)

description: Loads of floral and mineral notes, especially for a 2003. Layers of ripe pears and honey cascade across the palate, followed by a mineral reprise on the finish. Elegant and complete. Imported by Polaner Selections.
title: La Soufrandiére 2003 Climat Les Quarts  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Deliciously fresh, this is almost delicate, certainly elegant. There is great balance here, the wood just lightly toasty over the smooth, creamy white fruit flavors. For a wine from a lesser Burgundy appellation, this is impressive.
title: Morey-Blanc 2005  Auxey-Duresses

description: This rich, still-young wine displays a good balance between fruit and structure. Acidity is balanced by the ripe yellow fruits, mineral texture and rapier-like character. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2017 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The tight structure of this wine influenced Moreau to hold back its release until May 2002. Now that it's available, expect a full-bodied, powerful Chablis that combines aromas and flavors of butter, peach, apple and nuts in a ready-to-drink package.
title: J. Moreau & Fils 1997 Cuvee Joyeaux Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From vines on the cooler left bank of the Serein river, this wine offers notes of toast, spice and ripe yellow fruits cut by tense, zingy lemon zest. It is textured, tense and full of minerality. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Gérard Duplessis 2013 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The most taut and steely of the wines made by Guillaume Vrignaud from Fourchaume fruit, this offers a tight, minerally texture, lively acidity and an apple- and grapefruit-like crispness. With its structure, this has the potential to age for 4-5 years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2011 Les Champréaux Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Aged in oak and tank for 30 months, this wine wine is fat, full-bodied and rich. The texture is stretched tightly on a wire, with a steely incisiveness. The wine is intense and fresh, supporting aging as well as offering drinking pleasure now.
title: Garnier et Fils 2007 Grains Dorés  (Chablis)

description: Soft for a Chablis, leaning more to Burgundy proper with its rich toast and butter character. There is some minerality to give structure, the apple fruit coming to the fore as the wine opens up.
title: Chanson Pére et Fils 2008 Montmains  (Chablis)

description: Full and rich, packed with green plum, pear and lime zest flavors, this is a generous wine, its broad fruit offering both freshness and richness. There is a great final balance between toast and fruit.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils 2008 Vaillon Premier Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils

description: Made from young vines from the Vaulorent portion of the Fourchaume vineyard, this is an open, rounded and lively wine with white fruits and weight, just lifted by acidity.
title: William Févre 2005 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Brilliantly fresh, this wine is tight with acidity and textured with zingy citrus. Layers of apple and toast are already integrated in this bright wine. It's tangy, lively and likely to be ready to drink from 2017. The wine comes from the highest vineyard in Chassagne.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2013 En Pimont  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich but subtle. Ripe yellow fruits are laced with acidity that keeps the wine fresh, while toast and a hint of nutmeg balances the great fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
designation: Les Tourelles de la Crée Premier Cru
title: Château de la Crée 2016 Les Tourelles de la Crée Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: This spicy, wood-aged wine is ripe and full, sporting rich yellow fruits, acidity and taut, mineral acidity. Still young and with bursts of crispness and citrus fruits, the wine needs to take its time. It will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrétes 2016  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Produced from yields that were under 2 tons per acre, this wine is highly concentrated and rich, with exotic tropical fruit notes layered with orange marmalade. The only quibble is that the finish could be a little longer, but this is still a lovely mouthful. Drink now-2010. Imported by Frederick Wildman and Sons, Ltd.
title: Château de Fuissé 2003 Les Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Just as good, but different in style from the flamboyant 2003, the 2002 Les Clos is more classic, with upfront aromas of smoke and mineral that enfold honey, baked apple and citrus flavors. Finishes long, with a chalky, almost tactile quality. Drink now-2012. Imported by Frederick Wildman And Sons, Ltd.
title: Château de Fuissé 2002 Les Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This rich, concentrated wine is full of ripe white fruits accented by spice and bold apricot and peach flavors. Very drinkable now it will become even better in a few months. Drink from 2019.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This elegant wine offers good balance between the fruits that are beginning to mature and wonderful acidity that is keeping everything fresh. White fruits lifted by lime are given extra richness by hints of apricot. Drink now.
title: Domaine Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2014 En Remilly Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)
winery: Domaine Au Pied du Mont Chauve

description: Smooth and round, this wine has bright acidity, tempered by the toast and sweet apricot flavors. It has a structured core, and it finishes with the acidity. Age this for 2-3 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Ripe fruit and tropical flavors are cut by refreshing acidity in this bright, warm wine. Touches of apricots and kiwi come together in an harmonious whole. Drink this enticing wine from 2019.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2017  Saint-Véran

description: The Graviéres vineVard is Premier Cru for both white and red. This white version is currently dominated by a new wood aroma and a sweet toast flavor. It's full, soft and rounded, with flavors of creamed pears and ripe peaches.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2009 Graviéres Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This is Jean-Pierre Grossot's flagship wine. From around an acre of the Mont de Milieu vineyard, he produces an intensely ripe wine that pulls toward great minerality and steeliness. There is power as well, with just touches of wood.
title: Domaine Grossot 2005 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: An opulent style, very Meursault, the weight coming from the wood and the packed white fruit flavors. The wine is smooth, generous, a big ripe mouthful of fruit. The aftertaste shows some wood.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2007  Meursault

description: A well-structured wine, this is rich and smooth. Under this sheen, the wine offers a tight texture with minerality and zesty orange. These two elements make for a wine with both instant pleasure and richness and potential. Drink from late 2018.
title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2016 Classic  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A warm wine that shows rich flavors, ripe acidity and plenty of yellow fruits. It is rounded, smooth and likely to develop quickly. The acidity at the end is the crisp contrast to this full, forward wine. Drink from 2015.
designation: Les Murgers des Dents de Chien Premier Cru
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2011 Les Murgers des Dents de Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This is a steely wine, crisp and very textured. Lemon zest and acidity are given structure by the mineral character and by the touches of wood. It's a wine with a future, so drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils 2012 Vaillon Premier Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Pére et Fils

description: Dominated by wood, spice and almonds, this is a structured wine that moves in a straight line from its white fruits to ageworthy acidity and toast. It is still young, a wine that needs time to mellow, to move away from its tense fruit.
title: Domaine Pommier 2006 Beauroy Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This beautifully wood-aged wine comes from a single vineyard. It has a generous balance between tropical fruits and fresh toast. Acidity cuts through this ripe wine, adding a crisp character. The is delicious now, although it will be better from 2016.
title: Domaine Ferret 2012 Tête de Cru Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: An extra year in the bottle has really helped this wine, which opens with complex mineral, earth and green fruits that continue across the midpalate, and lead into a focused, elegant finish. The length and complexity, purity of fruit, and impeccable structure showcase the strengths of Bouchard.
title: Bouchard Pére & Fils 1997  Puligny-Montrachet

description: A rounded, ripe wine, this is packed with yellow fruits and touched with melon softness. It has toast as well as a mineral texture that give strong backing to the ripe fruitiness. This is likely to develop quickly, drink from 2019.
title: Jaffelin 2015 Passetemps Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This appellation is sometimes overlooked, but for white wines it is star. This is a ripe, full wine, toasty from wood aging and with rich apricot fruit cut by lemon acidity. It is balanced, full of fruitiness and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2015  Auxey-Duresses

description: Intense, feminine aromas such as talc, vanilla, mineral and pear waft from the nose. Lots of pear bursts from the palate, with an overlay of stone and nougat flavors. Finishes long with a glycerine-like texture and lean pear-skin and mineral flavors. If this sounds good to you, better hurry-only 100 cases were made.
title: Ropiteau 2000 Les Perrieres  (Meursault)

description: High up on the slope, the Sous le Puits vineyard has produced a ripe, open, buttery wine that is full of generous, opulent fruit. It is packed with pineapple, tropical fruit and lime flavors, along with a hint of caramel and almonds. Ready to drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2004 Sous le Puits Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: No relation to the late, great coach, but a class act nonetheless. This lovely wine displays spicy pear and apple fruit, a full, creamy midpalate that suggests extra time on the lees, and a pleasing, textured finish. Fine value.
title: Bouchard Pére & Fils 1998 Clos St.-Landry  (Beaune)

description: A blend from a number of small parcels, this is a deliciously crafted wine, its creamy texture bringing richness over fresh pear fruits. There is weight here as well from the rich soil of the vineyards, but the crisp acidity is never far away. Imported by Boisset America.
title: Domaine de la Vougeraie 2006  Beaune

description: This is no basic white Burgundy. With balanced wood aging and ripe fruit, it is rich and full in the mouth. It has tense acidity as well as an almost honeyed character. The wood fits well into this wine along with final acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: The picturesque name of the wine, the vineyard where God sits, comes from a monopole-a walled property in the hills behind Beaune, wholly owned by the Château de Santenay. Ripe and smooth with an attractive, crisp texture, the wine is ready to drink. A touch of toast gives extra interest.
title: Château de Santenay 2012 Clos de la Chaise Dieu  (Bourgogne Hautes Cotes de Beaune)

description: This wine comes from a small parcel of vines in this 75-acre estate. A touch of caramel fills out the rich palate and gives weight to the citrus and apple flavors and tight minerality. A young wine, it needs to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Passy le Clou 2017 Beauroy Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The toast shows through strongly in this wine, giving a burnt edge. At the same time, the delicious fruit with its flavors of peach and green plum, is rich enough to develop well and produce a balanced wine.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2009 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Sweet, full-fruit flavors and elegance mark this friendly wine. The wood flavors blend effortlessly with the citrus and kiwi fruit, leaving a fresh, lifted aftertaste. The 2004 marks a good return to form after the less successful 2003s from this domaine.
title: Domaine René Monnier 2004  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: This wood-aged wine is crisp and displays a great balance between acidity and rich fruits. The wine is still young, although you can see the good acidity, mineral texture and refined toastiness. The elements are coming together to give a wine that will age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Chassagne-Montrachet 2011  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Peach, orange and spice aromas and flavors, a buttery, full mouthfeel and nicely utilized oak all combine to create a harmonious impression. Ripe apple and butterscotch flavors show good weight. The long toasty finish maintains harmony and balance all the way.
title: Olivier Leflaive 1998 1 er Cru Charmes  (Meursault)

description: This bright, crisp wine has good acidity and aging potential. It is rich at the same time, with plenty of acidity and a lively aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2017 Classic  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A bit closed right now, but the concentration and elegance is still evident. You get glimpses of pear, apple and citrus flavors and a long, anise-tinged finish, but hold another few years to let it blossom. Drink 2008-2015. Imported by Frederick Wildman and Sons, Ltd.
title: Château de Fuissé 2002 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is full of acidity, with a crisp edge that's a delicious part of the riper fruit. The wood-aging spiciness is well judged to give a balanced wine that is generous and ready to drink.
title: Château de Beauregard 2015 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Attractive spice and green-fruit aromas lead to this fresh, ripe wine. Touches of wood give a spicy buttery taste that contrasts easily with the flavors. Fruity with a light mineral character, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2014 Les Houilléres  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: While this wine is rich, its tight texture brings out the minerality. Yellow fruits and toast are balanced with zingy acidity for a wine that will need time to broaden out. Drink from 2021.
designation: Les Murgers des Denys de Chien Premier Cru
title: Roux Pére et Fils 2015 Les Murgers des Denys de Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Packed with fruit, this young wine is already delicious. Acidity, crisp texture, zingy orange and lemon-peel flavors all contribute to a ripe, refreshing wine. It has the lift of the vintage, bright and full of fruitiness from start to finish.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2016 Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)

description: Santenay, which is located toward the south of the Côte de Beaune, is known for its wines that are accessible and early maturing. This ripe selection bursts with flavors of yellow fruit and citrus, touched by wood influence. Drink it over the next year, or age it for 3-4.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2010 Graviéres Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Starts off a bit nutty and leesy, with those aromas balanced by white peaches. But once on the palate, lime and mineral flavors surge to the fore, ending long and citrusy.
title: Domaine Morey Coffinet 2000 Les Caillerets Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Textured wine, the crisp white fruits are tight against acidity and spice. It fills the mouth, broadening into a wine that becomes creamy, with wood and green plum skins giving structure. This is another example of how a lesser appellation can shine at the hands of a master vigneron.
title: Domaine Jayer-Gilles 2006  Bourgogne Hautes Cotes de Beaune

description: A rich, buttery wine, with classic mineral and citrus characters. Very taut and tight, while layering fresh fruit flavors. Crisp and rounded at the same time.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2008  Puligny-Montrachet

description: A properly steely, mineral-structured wine. It has citrus, pink grapefruit, green berries and a great core of tight fruits and acidity. With its green apple skin structure, this is vibrant and deliciously taut. Imported by Wilson Daniels Ltd.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2007 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Spicy and rich, this generous, single-vineyard wine is full bodied, creamy and ripe. Yellow fruits are balanced by bright acidity and a tight mineral character. It is still structured, with wood aging flavors and a juicy crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Gérard Thomas et Filles 2015 Le Trézin  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Slow to show its quality, with a little aeration this becomes a superripe wine, its wood element dominated by the intense tropical fruits. There is some balancing restraint in the citrus character, along with the acidity. Enjoy now.
title: Roux Pére et Fils 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Meursault)

description: This mouthfilling Chard adds hints of honey and acacia blossom to luscious aromas of toasted nuts and citrus. Honey, nuts, mineral and citrus notes mingle easily on the palate, while the finish picks up hints of oaky spice and orange peel. Low acid ity suggests early consumption; drink now-2010. Imported by Dreyfus, Ashby & Co.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2003 Folatiéres Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Strongly wood-aged, this is a ripe, toasty wine. The citrus and creamed apple fruits are still working their way through the wood flavors. It's going to be richly fruity wine with a round texture that is cut by acidity. Give it time and drink from 2018.
title: Louis Jadot 2012 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lés-Beaune)

description: The biggest of the Latour Meursaults, with extra layers of ripe fruit and nuances of toast and nuts extending into a textured, lengthy finish. Focused and elegant.
title: Louis Latour 1998 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: From a parcel of vines in the Meursault village appellation, this attractive, soft wine has ripe grapefruit and pear flavors to go with the crisp acidity and the lightest touch of wood. Drink from 2015.
title: Bouchard Pére & Fils 2011 Les Clous  (Meursault)

description: Rich yet structured, this village wine from Meursault is made in a taut, tight style. Its acidity pushes through the toast flavor, which creates a nervy texture. Ready to drink  in 1-2 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Meursault

description: On the mineral side of Meursault, the has a very textured feel, with acidity to go with the honey note. Finely balanced, warm and ripe, this has a crisp, tight finish.
title: Henri de Villamont 2009 Les Clous  (Meursault)

description: The Ile de Vergelesses Premier Cru, mainly planted with Pinot Noir, also has a small parcel of Chardonnay in a chalky part of the vineyard. This white brings out great minerality, showing the acidity of the year, very crisp and citrusy.
title: Domaine Chandon de Briailles 2007 Ile de Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: A rich, ripe while still mineral wine, this is concentrated and dense with fruit. It has a good texture as well as a layer of toast that gives extra depth. The wine has spice and a stylish, crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Full in the mouth, this rich wine is dominated by yellow fruits and ripe apricots lifted by a touch of toast. Great acidity conveys a fresh and tangy character. The wine is still developing as the full fruitiness comes forward. Drink from 2017.
title: Louis Max 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Crisp and incisive, a wine that shows roundness and softness, finished with bright and fresh acidity. A small amount of Pinot Blanc is in the blend, a legacy of plantings in the 1980s.
title: Chanson Pére et Fils 2007 Haut-Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lés-Beaune)

description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is generous and smooth. Spice and toastiness are balanced by the apricot and citrus fruits. One gives richness, the other crispness. It is a wine with a future. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Les Reversées Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A wine that brings out soft richness, with a creamy apple texture layered with green plum skin tannins. The wine has some tautness as well, giving a tight structure that opens up. There's a great mineral, steely streak, with freshness showing through on the finish.
title: Faiveley 2007 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A big, ripe wine that also keeps an edgy character, typical of the year. It has a fine contrast between full apple and pear fruits and a zesty tang of acidity and texture. It does need a few months' aging.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2008  Chassagne-Montrachet
